definition: double/twice/simultaneous/holding two or more (official) posts at the same time
to prepare/get ready/to provide or equip

sentences.english: The combingtion of steaming and roasting is also one of the features of this machine.
sentences.chinese: 蒸炒兼备又是本设备的特点之一。

sentences.english: I envy you for giving such a personable and astute son gifted in both cultural and military affairs.
sentences.chinese: 朕羡慕你，有这样识大体明事理，且文武兼备的儿子。

sentences.english: Bachchan is beautiful, talented and also shrewd in business.
sentences.chinese: 巴臣不只才貌兼备，还有精明的生意头脑。

sentences.english: He wrote a book of poetry, and he was a both civil and military general.
sentences.chinese: 留有诗集一部，是住文武兼备的将军。

sentences.english: This museum offers both information and amusement.
sentences.chinese: 这间博物馆信息性与娱乐性兼备。

sentences.english: We should choose state leaders for their talents and virtue.
sentences.chinese: 我们应该按照德才兼备的标准来挑选国家领导人。

sentences.english: Is a comprehensive offensive and defensive players.
sentences.chinese: 是一个攻防兼备的综合性选手。

sentences.english: Most of us have a little of both in us, but lean one way or the other.
sentences.chinese: 我们大多数人都是两者兼备的，但会倾向于其中一种。

sentences.english: The expression physique performance can't be ignored in the traditional vocal music.
sentences.chinese: “神形兼备”的表演在民族声乐演唱中是不容忽视的。

sentences.english: Aircraft carrier fleet has diversiform campaign abilities for attack and defense.
sentences.chinese: 航母编队具有攻防兼备的多种作战能力。

sentences.english: Character portraits, the clothing lines smooth, full of different texture.
sentences.chinese: 人物形神兼备，衣纹流畅，富有不同的质感。

sentences.english: This can become a good student ability and political integrity in the 21st century.
sentences.chinese: 这样才能成为一个21世纪德才兼备的好学生。

sentences.english: He also claims to select cadres under the principle "combining ability with political integrity, giving priority to morals".
sentences.chinese: 主张采取“德才兼备，以德为主”的原则选拔干部。

sentences.english: The show is relatively new, and is now in its second season.
sentences.chinese: 严肃与搞笑兼备，还挺新的，才第二季。

definition: to exist at the same time/to coexist
to attend simultaneously to two or more things/to balance (career and family, family and education etc)
(of a person) beautiful inside and out
to lay equal stress on/to pay equal attention to
to possess/to have/equipped with/able to fulfill (conditions or requirements)
to bring out the best in each other (idiom)/to complement one another well
can be rated as/can be said to be
not a single one is dispensable/can't do without either
